definition: noble and lowly/high versus low social hierarchy of ruler to people, father to son, husband to wife in Confucianism
close and distant, rich and poor (idiom); everyone/all possible relations

sentences.english: Person's one birth predestined one personality of high or low?
sentences.chinese: 人一出生就注定了身份的贵贱吗？

sentences.english: People are equal regardless of high or low, will not go beyond the "benevolence" than for their survival.
sentences.chinese: 人不论高低贵贱，都不会超越“仁”之外而生存。

sentences.english: In the mourning for a father or mother， he allowed no difference between the noble and the mean.
Set me in high, or yet in low degree;
sentences.chinese: 无论让我的身份高低贵贱。

sentences.english: There is neither lowliness nor nobleness in careers.
sentences.chinese: 事业上没有高低贵贱之分。

sentences.english: There is no distinction or distinction, personality on the basis of equality is the intersection.
sentences.chinese: 没有高低贵贱之分，人格上的平等是相交的基础。

sentences.english: I will buy it, dear or cheap.
To love all mankind, from the greatest to the lowest, a cheerful state of being is required;
sentences.chinese: 爱整个人类，不分贵贱高低，需要有诚意的胸怀。

sentences.english: Do not be afraid of any man, for judgment belongs to God.
sentences.chinese: 听讼不可分贵贱，不可惧怕人，因为审判是属乎神的。

definition: close and distant, rich and poor (idiom); everyone/all possible relations
"the four classes" of ancient China, i.e. scholars, farmers, artisans, and merchants
lit. peddlers and carriers/common people/lower class
to treat everyone equally favorably (idiom); not to discriminate between people
"the four classes" of ancient China, i.e. scholars, farmers, artisans, and merchants
to be looked after in life and given a proper burial thereafter (idiom)
